拾.definition: to pick up; to collate or arrange; ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

拾人牙慧.definition: to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own; to parrot

拾得.definition: to find; to pick up; to collect

拾掇.definition: to clear up; to tidy up; to pick up; to repair

拾獲.definition: to find; to pick up; to obtain

拾級.definition: to go up or down stairs step by step

拾級而上.definition: to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)

拾芥.definition: to pick up cress; fig. sth easy to do; a piece of cake

拾荒.definition: to glean; to collect scraps; to eke out a meager living

拾遺.definition: to pocket a lost article; (fig.) to correct others' errors; to remedy omissions (in a text etc)

拾遺補缺.definition: to remedy omissions and correct errors (idiom)

拾金不昧.definition: to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner

拾零.definition: to pick up bits; to collect scrap material; tidbits; gleanings (used as gossip)
